evidence_items.text: A tug driving instructor (tug instructor) and trainee tug driver (trainee driver) were seated beside each other in the tug. The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so. The headset operator continued walking on the right side of the tug, abeam its cabin. The wingman was on the left just ahead of the tug.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The tug instructor pulled the aircraft forward off the fence then stopped the tug.

slot_statements.availability: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was evident during the early phase of the flight on Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA on 12-25, as recorded in the historical dynamic understanding timeline t1.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The explanation of communication/coordination breakdown among crew resists defeaters by consistently matching the observed crew behavior patterns and recorded events in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 early timeline t1.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The communication/coordination breakdown aligns with key features observed in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25, including misaligned crew interactions and coordination failures documented in the early timeline t1.

slot_statements.availability: The procedural deviation in pushback execution is observable and documented within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA during the time frame 12-25, specifically in the hist_dynamic_und_t1_early dataset.
slot_statements.defeater_resistance: The identified procedural deviation in pushback execution demonstrates resistance to common defeaters, maintaining its validity and significance within the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA 12-25 hist_dynamic_und_t1_early context.
slot_statements.fit_to_key_features: The procedural deviation aligns with key features identified in the pushback process of the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA, as captured in the hist_dynamic_und_t1_early scope, indicating a consistent pattern of deviation.

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown among crew was evident during the early phase of the flight on Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA on 12-25, as recorded in the historical dynamic understanding timeline t1.

assumptions: Communication with headset operator reflects crew coordination
The pushback events and errors reflect coordination breakdown rather than only procedural deviation
defeaters: If evidence showed clear, effective communication and coordination preventing errors
If the incident was solely due to procedural deviation without coordination failure

quotes.exact_quote: The flight crew were in communication with the headset operator via the aircraft’s interphone.
The trainee driver decided to stop the pushback and asked the tug instructor to take over.

After swapping seats the instructor recommenced the pushback, correcting the aircraft back onto the taxiway centreline. He continued to reassure and advise the trainee while performing the pushback, looking at her while doing so.

The aircraft’s nosewheel reached the ‘Tug release point’ (TRP) ground markings. However, it continued moving beyond the TRP with its engine at idle and hit the blast barrier at the end of the cul-de-sac.
The tug instructor pulled the aircraft forward off the fence then stopped the tug.

outcome.reasoning_summary: Evidence H1-H5 shows communication among crew and headset operator, decisions to stop and resume pushback, and the aircraft moving beyond the TRP causing a collision, indicating coordination issues supporting the communication breakdown claim.
outcome.uncertainty_source: ambiguity in distinguishing procedural deviation from coordination failure

node.statement: The communication/coordination breakdown aligns with key features observed in the Boeing 737-8AS 9H-QAA incident on 12-25, including misaligned crew interactions and coordination failures documented in the early timeline t1.

assumptions: Crew interactions described imply coordination failures
The trainee's decision to stop and hand over control indicates misaligned coordination
defeaters: If evidence showed clear, aligned crew communication and coordination without misalignment or failures
If procedural deviations better explained the events without coordination breakdown
